intro: Bonamia, commonly known as false mignonette, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Violaceae. It consists of several species, most of which are native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. The plants typically have alternate, ovate to lanceolate leaves and produce small, fragrant, white or pink flowers. They are often cultivated for their ornamental value due to their delicate appearance and pleasant scent. Bonamia species are generally easy to grow in well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade.
